comment.text: Integrin ITGAM/ITGB2 is implicated in various adhesive interactions of monocytes, macrophages and granulocytes as well as in mediating the uptake of complement-coated particles and pathogens (PubMed:9558116, PubMed:20008295). It is identical with CR-3, the receptor for the iC3b fragment of the third complement component. It probably recognizes the R-G-D peptide in C3b. Integrin ITGAM/ITGB2 is also a receptor for fibrinogen, factor X and ICAM1. It recognizes P1 and P2 peptides of fibrinogen gamma chain. Regulates neutrophil migration (PubMed:28807980). In association with beta subunit ITGB2/CD18, required for CD177-PRTN3-mediated activation of TNF primed neutrophils (PubMed:21193407). May regulate phagocytosis-induced apoptosis in extravasated neutrophils (By similarity). May play a role in mast cell development (By similarity). Required with TYROBP/DAP12 in microglia to control production of microglial superoxide ions which promote the neuronal apoptosis that occurs during brain development (By similarity).

Heterodimer of an alpha and a beta subunit. ITGAM associates with ITGB2. Found in a complex with CD177 and ITGB2/CD18 (PubMed:21193407). Interacts with JAM3 (PubMed:15194813, PubMed:12208882). Interacts with THBD (PubMed:27055590). Interacts with complement factor H/CFH; this interaction mediates adhesion of neutrophils to pathogens leading to pathogen clearance.
Predominantly expressed in monocytes and granulocytes (PubMed:1346576). Expressed in neutrophils (at protein level) (PubMed:21193407).
The integrin I-domain (insert) is a VWFA domain. Integrins with I-domains do not undergo protease cleavage.

disease.name: Systemic lupus erythematosus 6
disease.description: A chronic, relapsing, inflammatory, and often febrile multisystemic disorder of connective tissue, characterized principally by involvement of the skin, joints, kidneys and serosal membranes. It is of unknown etiology, but is thought to represent a failure of the regulatory mechanisms of the autoimmune system. The disease is marked by a wide range of system dysfunctions, an elevated erythrocyte sedimentation rate, and the formation of LE cells in the blood or bone marrow.

comment.text: Disease susceptibility may be associated with variations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the integrin alpha chain family.

property.value: Cell surface interactions at the vascular wall
Expressed in bone marrow cell and 198 other tissues

P:positive regulation of prostaglandin-E synthase activity
P:positive regulation of protein targeting to membrane
P:positive regulation of superoxide anion generation
